result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Prior: 412 Ninth St, Racine, WI 53403

9:40 AM Defendant Kayla R Pugh not in court.  Attorney Joe Edward Kremkoski in court for Kayla R Pugh.  Prosecuting attorney Jennifer Flynn in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter Donna Moore. 
Matter scheduled as a status conference. 
Defendant does not appear. 
Defense has no explanation for why the defendant does not appear. Defense indicates he has not seen the amended criminal complaint. Defense indicates he has a conflict with this case. 
BTC: No appearance, Bench Warrant requested/ordered, bond forfeited.

Back on the record at 10:26 AM with the same appearances. 
Defendant Kayla Pugh now present in court, in person. 
Defense indicates he had a discussion with the defendant regarding the offer the State has made. Seeking the matter is set over for a plea and sentencing. 
BTC: VACATE WARRANT and reinstate bond. Matter set over for COP.
